similarities: Both are sale deeds executed in New Delhi
The seller is the absolute owner of the property
The buyer has agreed to purchase the property after inspection
The seller confirms the property is free from encumbrances, mortgages, or litigation
Ownership rights will be transferred upon registration and full payment of consideration
Both parties agree to comply with the Transfer of Property Act, 1882
differences: Doc 1 is for a residential property, Doc 2 is for a commercial property
The seller's and buyer's names and addresses are different
The property location is the same (Connaught Place), but the addresses differ
The consideration for Doc 2 is higher (₹2,00,00,000 compared to ₹1,50,00,000)

similarities: Both documents mention the execution of an agreement by the seller and buyer.
Both documents specify the presence of witnesses during the execution.
The execution date is mentioned but not explicitly provided in the comparison text.
differences: The names of the witnesses are different.
Specific names of the witnesses in document 1 are Anil Kumar and Priya Singh.
Specific names of the witnesses in document 2 are Sunil Verma and Kavita Sharma.
